title: Australian Unity to merge funds into $537 million fund
text:
Australian Unity will merge its retail property fund and a larger general commercial property fund to create a single $537 million fund that it says will boost liquidity for investors, widen diversification and lower the risks.

Investors in the mutual company's $155 million Retail Property Fund and the Diversified Property Fund that has $348 million in direct property, as well as holdings in listed REITs last week, voted to combine them into one fund that could raise money for acquisitions and investments more easily from a wider investor base, fund manager Nikki Panagopoulos said.

Australian Unity fund manager Nikki Panagopoulos.

The retail fund, which made a total return of 10.15 per cent over the past year and 16.56 per cent over the past five years, holds a neighbourhood shopping centre in Blackburn, 18km east of the Melbourne CBD and two service stations leased to Caltex in Wyong on the NSW central coast.

"They are very, very good assets in the sense that they’re probably non-discretionary and fit that consumer and meet a need ... but the diversified fund holds three neighbourhood centres as well," Ms Panagopoulos told The Australian Financial Review.

But the move was also a response to the challenged environment for any fund that focussed solely on the asset class of retail property, she said.
description: Combination of funds creates more diversity at a time when retail property assets are 'challenged'.
